Package models

Interface FlexiblePortfolio

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPortfolio, FlexiblePortfolioImpl
    public interface FlexiblePortfolio
    This interface represents the operations on a single Flexible portfolio.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void buyStock​(java.lang.String symbol, java.time.LocalDate date, float numberOfShares, float transactionCost)
      This method is used to buy a stock and add it to this user's active portfolio.
      java.lang.StringBuilder getComposition​(java.time.LocalDate date)
      This method is used to get the composition of this user's active portfolio.
      float getCostBasis​(java.time.LocalDate date, ApiType apiType)
      This method is used to get the cost basis of this user's active portfolio.Cost Basis shows the total amount of money invested in a portfolio by a specific date.
      java.lang.StringBuilder getPlot​(java.time.LocalDate startDate, java.time.LocalDate endDate, ApiType apiType)
      This method tell the user how a particular portfolio has performed over a period of time using a line chart by taking date ranges in which he wants to see the performance.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​FlexibleStocksList> getStocksList()
      This method gives a hashmap representing all the stocks present in this portfolio.
      float getTotalValue​(java.lang.String date, ApiType apiType)
      This method is used to get the total value of this user's active portfolio on a certain date.

      This method is used to sell a stock from user's active portfolio.
      boolean stockExists​(java.lang.String symbol)
      This method checks if a particular stock is present in a portfolio.

    • Method Detail

      • buyStock

        void buyStock​(java.lang.String symbol,
              java.time.LocalDate date,
              float numberOfShares,
              float transactionCost)
        This method is used to buy a stock and add it to this user's active portfolio. A flexible portfolio contains a hashmap which stores all these stocks. To add a stock to the portfolio user needs to enter Stock Symbol, number of shares he wants, date on which he wants and the transaction cost associated with it.
        Parameters:
        symbol - String which should be a valid.
        numberOfShares - float which is the number of shares the user wants of that company.
        date - LocalDate date on which he wants to purchase.
        transactionCost - float which is transaction associated for this transaction.

      • sellStock

        void sellStock​(java.lang.String symbol,
               java.time.LocalDate date,
               float numberOfShares,
               float transactionCost)
        This method is used to sell a stock from user's active portfolio. It checks if it possible to sell the stocks and sells them only if it is possible. To sell a stock from a portfolio user needs to enter Stock Symbol, number of shares he wants, date on which he wants to sell and the transaction cost associated with it.
        Parameters:
        symbol - String which should be a valid.
        numberOfShares - float which is the number of shares the user wants to sell.
        date - LocalDate date on which he wants to sell.
        transactionCost - float which is transaction associated for this transaction.

      • getPlot

        java.lang.StringBuilder getPlot​(java.time.LocalDate startDate,
                                java.time.LocalDate endDate,
                                ApiType apiType)
        This method tell the user how a particular portfolio has performed over a period of time using a line chart by taking date ranges in which he wants to see the performance.
        Parameters:
        startDate - LocalDate start date of the range.
        endDate - LocalDate end date of the range.
        apiType - ApiType used determine which third party api is to be called.
        Returns:
        plot showing the performance of the portfolio.

      • getTotalValue

        float getTotalValue​(java.lang.String date,
                    ApiType apiType)
        This method is used to get the total value of this user's active portfolio on a certain date. If weekend values are given then it tells the user to enter a date which is not weekend.
        Parameters:
        date - String which is given by the user
        apiType - ApiType used determine which third party api is to be called.
        Returns:
        total value of the portfolio on a certain date.

      • getComposition

        java.lang.StringBuilder getComposition​(java.time.LocalDate date)
        This method is used to get the composition of this user's active portfolio. Composition shows the symbol and number of shares of each stock in a portfolio purchased before a particular day.
        Parameters:
        date - String which is given by the user
        Returns:
        StringBuilder which has symbol and number of shares for each stock in portfolio

      • getCostBasis

        float getCostBasis​(java.time.LocalDate date,
                   ApiType apiType)
        This method is used to get the cost basis of this user's active portfolio.Cost Basis shows the total amount of money invested in a portfolio by a specific date.
        Parameters:
        date - String which is given by the user
        apiType - ApiType used determine which third party api is to be called.
        Returns:
        float which has the total amount of money invested in a portfolio by a specific date

      • getStocksList

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​FlexibleStocksList> getStocksList()
        This method gives a hashmap representing all the stocks present in this portfolio.
        Returns:
        Hashmap of all the stocks in this portfolio

      • stockExists

        boolean stockExists​(java.lang.String symbol)
        This method checks if a particular stock is present in a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        symbol - Symbol for validation.
        Returns:
        boolean result of a validation.
